benchmark_details.name: LaMPilot-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: LaMPilot-Bench is the first benchmark dataset specifically designed to quantitatively evaluate the efficacy of language model programs in autonomous driving (AD). Each scenario in the benchmark consists of a task described in natural language, along with a simulated environment for comprehensive evaluation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the instruction-following capabilities of LLM-based agents in autonomous driving.

data.source: The LaMPilot dataset consists of semi-human-annotated traffic scenes obtained from Road and Traffic simulation environments.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of LLM-generated policies in the simulated environment.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in safety (TTC), stability (SV), and efficiency (TE).
methodology.validation: Evaluated against heuristic baselines and off-the-shelf large language models.
